election_record.label: New York 1804 State Senate, Western District

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 1 vote as Moss Cent.

sub_unit.name: Dryden
sub_unit.note: Votes from Dryden were rejected from some vote tallies for Cayuga county.

sub_unit.name: Milton
sub_unit.note: Jedidiah Peck received 1 vote as Jedediah Price.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: Though the votes listed here for Henry Huntington add up to 1523, the official canvas of votes for the Western District lists 1517 for Henry Huntington.
The Western Oracle, and Chenango Weekly Magazine (Sherburne, NY), May 24, lists 1520 votes and 1528 votes for Jedediah Peck for Henry Huntington in Chenango county.
Moss Kent received 27 votes as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: In 1802, Genesee county was formed from part Ontario county, but the two continued to vote together in 1804, and most newspapers list returns from the two counties together.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as Henry Hunting.
Jedidiah Peck received 2 votes as Jedediah Prich.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 votes as Henry Hunnington.
Jedediah Peck received 11 votes as Jediah Peck, 1 vote as Jedediah Pece and 1 vote as Kedediah Peec.
Moss Kent received 1 vote as Moss Rent and 1 vote as Moors Kent.
Jedediah Sanger received 1 vote as Jedah Sanger.

sub_unit.name: Leyden
sub_unit.note: Most sources list 38 votes for Moss Kent in Leyden, though the offical tally of votes lists 58.

sub_unit.name: Mexico
sub_unit.note: Though counted here, returns from Mexico were rejected from the official statewide vote tally.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: Jedediah Peck received 1 vote as Jedediah Price.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: In 1802, Genesee county was formed from part Ontario county, but the two continued to vote together in 1804, and most newspapers list returns from both counties together.
Henry Huntington received 2 votes as Henry Huntingtor and 1 vote as Henry Huntingto.
Moss Kent received 16 votes as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Farmington
sub_unit.note: Moss Kent received 15 votes as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Jerusalem
sub_unit.note: The Ontario Repository, May 1 lists 9 votes for each Henry Huntington and Jedediah Peck, and 13 votes for each Moss Kent and Jedediah Sanger.

sub_unit.name: Pittstown
sub_unit.note: The Ontario Repository, May 8, lists 37 votes for Henry Huntington and 36 votes for Jedediah Peck in Pittstown.

sub_unit.name: Sodus
sub_unit.note: The Ontario Repository, May 1, lists five votes for Henry Huntington in Sodus.
Moss Kent received 1 vote as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote for Henry Hunting.
Moss Kent received 1 vote as Moses Kent.

sub_unit.name: Hartwick
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 11, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19, and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 17, list 98 votes for Jedediah Sanger in Hartwick.

sub_unit.name: Springfield
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 11, Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19, and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 17, list 66 votes for Henry Huntington in Springfield.

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as Harry Huntington.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
The Western Oracle, and Chenango Weekly Magazine (Sherburne, NY). May 24, 1804.
